TopicTitle: The unofficially official 0.24-Kerbapalooza Thread - Now extra #HYPETRAIN!

Articles.Content:
Dean Hall is more hyped than a lot of people here.

https://twitter.com/rocket2guns/status/489451014408642560

Is anyone else not playing KSP until the 0.24 release because they feel it's not "worth it"?

If that's your philosophy, it's never "worth it"

Dean Hall is more hyped than a lot of people here.

https://twitter.com/rocket2guns/status/489451014408642560

I approve this message.

Is anyone else not playing KSP until the 0.24 release because they feel it's not "worth it"?

I felt a bit burnt out from the game, so I haven't played for about a month and a half. I'm going to get back into it as soon as the next update is released.
Awwww...any chance of us finding out just what the bug causing the delay was after we get the game in our hands?
At this point I'm thinking we have a .23.5 situation and am not looking for the update until Tuesday.

Mu, just now on IRC (#kspofficial):

[16:46 UTC] [Mu] well i wouldnt hold my breath for a release today

I asked for permission to quote, he gave it but asked that I be specific about the time.

I am resigning myself to a Monday or Tuesday release. Anything before would be a nice surprise.
I was really hoping for an update on Apollo 11's launch anniversary.
Im actually pretty optimistic about a release today. I think the chances are pretty goo we will get what we want today.

I am resigning myself to a Monday or Tuesday release. Anything before would be a nice surprise.

Yeah, it seems like we were "very close" on Monday and since the their language has been continually rolled back on their optimism on getting it out.

At this point I'm thinking we have a .23.5 situation and am not looking for the update until Tuesday.

Yea seems like a similar situation to the last attempted release for sure.

Fool me once, shame on you.

Fool me twice, shame on me.

Fool me three times...
It will be today. Tomorrow on the outside. But I'll eat my hat if were not all doing contracts tomorrow night.
...shame the dog
I've just been playing vanilla .23.5 because I know once I can use all my RAM it's going to be even more mod-city than usual

the laptop i run KSP on has 4GB, on 64bit OS. will i be ok? its something everyone seems worried about, and its taking me ages to sift through all the replies in this thread looking for an answer.

Nothing to worry about - you have to choose to run the 64-bit version, otherwise just running from steam should run the 32-bit version (I think... unless steam auto-detects a 64-bit system...)

You get both .exe files in the game folder, so you can always put a shortcut on desktop or somewhere
If you guys are bored MasterMapMaker has a really good plane construction twitch going on.
and there goes another experimentals update on steamdb

and there goes another experimentals update on steamdb

Might it be the last one before 0.24?

Might it be the last one before 0.24?

It might... or it might not.
I'd say if we see several more builds go up for the other versions w/o any new Win 32bit builds theres a good chance that release is imminent.

Yeah, it seems like we were "very close" on Monday and since the their language has been continually rolled back on their optimism on getting it out.

Sadly, you're right FleetAdmiralJ. SQUAD sounded a lot more confident when they released the original video on .24 than they have each day since...getting a little less confident all the time (unless that's just a ploy).

Might it be the last one before 0.24?

There's always a chance. I'm inclined to think not after Mu's comment, and because this is the first push today...they've slowed down. Perhaps because they're no longer under pressure to get dond this week.

EDIT: @Manaani: We've seen that pattern with every experimentals upload. They build all 4 versions.

and there goes another experimentals update on steamdb

Yep, i instantly checked steamdb when the site started producing bad gateways^^

and there goes another experimentals update on steamdb

It looks to me like it's only a bug affecting the Windows 32 bit and 64 bit version of the game.

It's getting near

Last time Bad gateways started, the release came out!

I will recommend listening to this at the moment it's released! :

Cheers!
